item.author: AntoineChn

item.title: RSS on Beehiv sites
item.description:
Hello community, most of us know the way to subscribe to Substack to simply to add "/feed" to end of a Substack's publication URL. Although, Beehiv, which is probably the biggest Substack competitor, does not have a way to pull a feed via RSS. Thoughts?

For examples sake https://schoolofhardknocks.beehiiv.com is the most recent Beehiv publication that I wanted to subscribe to but could not. I typically just ditch them, but I believe with RSSHub it will be possible.

item.author: Whichbfj28

item.title: Spot-On RSS Reader & Search Engine
item.description:
What feature is it?

Hi maybe you want to have a look into this application, which is a RSS Tool and a RSS Search Engine https://github.com/textbrowser/spot-on

Download all your RSS items into the RSS-Tool (Main Menu / View / RSS) and if downloaded, you can import these RSS Items into the application. This enables a Keyword-Search over all Items in the client and also in a Webinterface. The database can be shared via F2F and the URL-Key.

https://github.com/textbrowser/spot-on

What problem does this feature solve?

Means: you can create a search engine via RSS and share your RSS-URL-Database to friends via Key.

Additional description

Which RSS-Feed-Reader has the option to be a Search Engine?

maybe you want to evaluate it a bit and list it in the tools or even provide a search engine on you domain. If you like to provide a search engine domain with this tech, please addesss back and we create it. It would be one of the first websearch engines, which allows to download also the data index of the search engine - that is a really open source engine!

also you might look at: https://github.com/textbrowser/spot-on-shared-pages

PS: has github an RSS-Feed URL to provide these URLs as feed?

https://htmlpreview.github.io/?https://github.com/textbrowser/spot-on-shared-pages/blob/main/ae/https%253A%252F%252Faeon.co%252Fessays%252Fpioneering-sociologist-erving-goffman-saw-magic-in-the-mundane%253Futm_source%253Drss-feed

respective to show the commits in an RSS Feed https://github.com/textbrowser/spot-on-shared-pages/commits.atom as a page html-rendered and not as html-source? Then you can insert the commits of this github repo as website into Spot-On RSS Websearch again.

item.author: ghost

item.title: Rate Limits for Telegram Channel RSS feeds
item.description:
What feature is it?

Hello!

I want to better understand current rate limits on using /telegram/channel/<channel_id>?

Perhaps, if it's low â€“ can it somehow be increased, through proxies of a sort?

What problem does this feature solve?

For context, I am looking to continuously fetch information from telegram channel RSS feeds, as the current fetching mechanism is fetching only last 16 posts.

Additional description

Let me know if that is technically possible / limitations are know, and I can perhaps help out with the implementation.

This is not a duplicated feature request or new RSS proposal

  • [X] I have searched existing issues to ensure this feature has not already been requested and this is not a new RSS proposal.
item.author: 0xRaduan

item.title: Rate limiting on Twitter user feed
item.description:
What feature is it?

Hello!

I want to better understand current rate limits on using /twitter/user/<user> on one twitter account?

Perhaps, if it's low â€“ I would love to be able to add multiple accounts, so the RSSHub could possibly loop through them for me, and use those which are currently not rate-limited.

What problem does this feature solve?

I am looking to have around 5-10k user feeds, and want to loop on them on a certain basis(every 2-4 hours at this point), and want to understand, whether the solution with one account would be enough(assuming not) for this.

Additional description

Let me know, if that's possible, and I can perhaps contribute and add support for looping through accounts.

This is not a duplicated feature request or new RSS proposal

  • [X] I have searched existing issues to ensure this feature has not already been requested and this is not a new RSS proposal.

item.author: sherlcok314159

item.title: Is it possible for a non-developer to create a new rss feed from a site?
item.description:
I want to add a nsfw blog to my rss reader. I am not a developer. I looked over the docs and I am completely lost on how to do it.

The nsfw blog I want to add used to have an rss feed, but they removed it. rss radar only finds a comments feed on the site now, but I don't want that. I want an rss feed of the blog posts / articles / main links (whatever they are called). Is it possible for a non-dev to set up one?

I've looked through the docs. The nsfw blog I am trying to follow seems to be a wordpress blog, so I found this route: /blogs/wordpress/:domain/:https? and when I enter the domain of the nsfw blog, I get an error: "Error message: This RSS is disabled unless 'ALLOW_USER_SUPPLY_UNSAFE_DOMAIN' is set to 'true'."

I guess that means it can't work?

item.description:
å› ä¸ºä¹‹å‰åˆ›å»ºçš„twitter apiè¢«å°ï¼Œå·²ç»å¾ˆé•¿æ—¶é—´æ²¡ç”¨twitteräº†ï¼Œçœ‹äº†RSSHubæ–‡æ¡£ï¼Œå‘ç°å¯ä»¥åˆ›å»ºåŒ¿åapiè®¿é—®Twitterï¼Œä»¥ä¸‹è®°å½•ã€‚

æ­¥éª¤

1.å…ˆæŸ¥çœ‹æ–‡æ¡£åœ°ä½ï¼Œhttps://docs.rsshub.app/zh/routes/social-media#twitter ï¼Œhttps://docs.rsshub.app/zh/install/config#twitter ï¼Œhttps://github.com/zedeus/nitter/wiki/Guest-Account-Branch-Deployment#guest-accounts 2.ç¯å¢ƒå‡†å¤‡ï¼ŒDebianæ‰§è¡Œ sudo apt-get install curl jq 3.åˆ›å»ºtwitter.shè„šæœ¬ï¼Œä» https://github.com/zedeus/nitter/wiki/Guest-Account-Branch-Deployment#guest-accounts è·å–ï¼Œ23å¹´12æœˆ1æ—¥ï¼Œå†…å®¹å¦‚ä¸‹

#!/bin/bash

guest_token=$(curl -s -XPOST https://api.twitter.com/1.1/guest/activate.json -H 'Authorization: Bearer AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAFXzAwAAAAAAMHCxpeSDG1gLNLghVe8d74hl6k4%3DRUMF4xAQLsbeBhTSRrCiQpJtxoGWeyHrDb5te2jpGskWDFW82F' | jq -r '.guest_token')

flow_token=$(curl -s -XPOST 'https://api.twitter.com/1.1/onboarding/task.json?flow_name=welcome' \
          -H 'Authorization: Bearer AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAFXzAwAAAAAAMHCxpeSDG1gLNLghVe8d74hl6k4%3DRUMF4xAQLsbeBhTSRrCiQpJtxoGWeyHrDb5te2jpGskWDFW82F' \
          -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
          -H "User-Agent: TwitterAndroid/10.10.0" \
          -H "X-Guest-Token: ${guest_token}" \
          -d '{"flow_token":null,"input_flow_data":{"flow_context":{"start_location":{"location":"splash_screen"}}}}' | jq -r .flow_token)

curl -s -XPOST 'https://api.twitter.com/1.1/onboarding/task.json' \
          -H 'Authorization: Bearer AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAFXzAwAAAAAAMHCxpeSDG1gLNLghVe8d74hl6k4%3DRUMF4xAQLsbeBhTSRrCiQpJtxoGWeyHrDb5te2jpGskWDFW82F' \
          -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
          -H "User-Agent: TwitterAndroid/10.10.0" \
          -H "X-Guest-Token: ${guest_token}" \
          -d "{\"flow_token\":\"${flow_token}\",\"subtask_inputs\":[{\"open_link\":{\"link\":\"next_link\"},\"subtask_id\":\"NextTaskOpenLink\"}]}" | jq -c -r '.subtasks[0]|if(.open_account) then {oauth_token: .open_account.oauth_token, oauth_token_secret: .open_account.oauth_token_secret} else empty end'

item.author: aaro-n

item.title: Nested(multiple) crawling policy?
item.description:
Hi, I'm recently working on a transform/sitemap's sitemapindex protocol support.

For example, CNN's Sitemap Index is the case. This index contains multiple sitemaps. To build RSS of sitemaps' URLs, it needs to crawl the multiple URLs again.

I'm not sure if this is okay or not. Do you have any policy for this kind of pattern?

My current WIP code is here.
item.author: flrngel

item.title: No documentation regarding IG_COOKIE
item.description:
Routes

/instagram/2/

Full routes

/instagram/2/user/stefaniejoosten

Related documentation

https://docs.rsshub.app/install#route-specific-configurations

What is expected?

There's no information about what should be defined as IG_COOKIE. Which cookie? Instagram sessions sets many cookies.

What is actually happening?

IG_COOKIE isn't configurable without this information.

Deployment information

RSSHub demo (https://rsshub.app)

Deployment information (for self-hosted)

No response

Additional info

As expected, trying to use `/instagram/2/` throws an error:


throw Error('Instagram RSS is disabled due to the lack of <a href="https://docs.rsshub.app/install/#pei-zhi-bu-fen-rss-mo-kuai-pei-zhi">relevant config</a>')

This is not a code issue. It's a lack of documentation issue.

item.author: aaro-n

item.title: Any way to disable server statistics/debug info on /?
item.description:
What feature is it?

the debug section on / exposes a lot of information about what profiles/users the rsshub instance is used for folllowing, and for anything but the demo rsshub.app instance, this can be sensitive data. is there a simple ay to block this data from appearing without just blocking access to / in the load balancer?

What problem does this feature solve?

/ shows lots of information about specific URLs added that can potentially expose their operator or their social circle

Additional description

No response
